Sentencas: Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+delta)(4) (LSZG) materials can exhibit proton conduction by Li+/H+ ion exchange in hydrogen atmosphere.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It can be used in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) as an electrolyte.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, In3+ doped LSZG powders are synthesized by sol-gel method.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy, thermal gravimetric analyzer, and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy are used to investigate the effects of In doping on LSZG.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: All Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+delta)(4) (LISZG, 0 <= x <= 0.3) ceramics exhibit the same phase with LSZG.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The dopant of In promotes the sintering activity and Li+/H+ ion exchange rate of LSZG.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The optimum doping of In is x = 0.2.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At 600 degrees C, Li13.7In0.2Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+delta)(4) (0.2LISZG) shows a proton conductivity of 0.094 S/cm under 0.9 V direct current bias voltage.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, the single cell based on 0.2LISZG electrolyte is prepared, and it has been demonstrated that the practical utilization of 0.2LISZG in IT-SOFCs is feasible.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of In doped Li13.9Sr0.1Zn(GeO4+δ)4 electrolytes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells
